page.title: 12HOP FARMING IN MATHON.
page.content: In January,February,March and April it is quite quiet on the farm.In May the men start spraying the hops and corn.Also lots of people are employed to string and to do bracing,which is putting strings from the wires to a peg in the ground.In June the mechanic starts work on the hop machine,which takes the hops off the stalk (bine). Then in September the corn is harvested and the hops are taken from the field.A special harvester called a bine cutter,which cuts the bottom and a tractor and trailer comes along with people on who get the hops down onto the trailer from the wires.After they have been through the machine they go to be dried and put into hop pockets. Next they are taken to a brewery.From October to December it is quite quiet as well.
